oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Holographic Competition of Phases and Superconductivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kiritsis, Elias
Li, Li
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Strongly Correlated Electrons
Condensed Matter - Superconductivity
High Energy Physics - Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We use a holographic theory to model and study the competition of four phases: an antiferromagnetic phase, a superconducting phase, a metallic phase and a striped phase, using as control parameters temperature and a doping-like parameter. We analyse the various instabilities and determine the possible phases. One class of phase diagrams, that we analyse in detail, is similar to that of high-temperature superconductors as well as other strange metal materials.
Comment: 73 pages, 24 figures; v2: references added; v3: Two appendices are moved to the main text. Comments and figures added, typos fixed, to appear in JHEP
